intro: Koeleria paparistoi, commonly known as the Paparistos'koeleria, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the grass family, Poaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant produces tiny, wind-pollinated flowers that are typically greenish or pale blue in color. It is adapted to cold, arid conditions and thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and specialized habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
